programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: The battle between predator and prey is not always about power and strength. Knowing what lurks in the dark can mean the difference between life and death. Extraordinary powers that penetrate darkness give some creatures the edge, and the chance to live another day.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: To win the game of life, it can take more than brute force. Animals with a super-powered sixth sense can get the edge on fast-moving prey, beat the elements, and find food in unlikely places.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how wolf packs hunt prey, offering new perspectives on the way they work together to locate, isolate and bring down large bison and musk oxen. programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: In the wild, animals face life or death battles every day, from escaping deadly predators to fighting off fierce rivals. Sometimes brute force isn‚Äôt enough to prevail. programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: When you've got it all, why would you give it all up? We expect animals to take the path of least resistance -- choosing the easiest and surest ways to get food, safety and comfort. But animals aren't always so predictable.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads along the cliffs and sandy flats of the Australian coast to discover which animal dominates the shoreline. His first encounter is with a white -bellied sea eagle, a bird with extremely sharp talons, followed by the estuarine stonefish, the most venomous fish in the world. Finally, Phil takes a closer look at the notorious stingray.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads into the mangroves to discover which animal is truly built to survive the mud and muck. He encounters a feisty mud crab with huge pincers and catches a shovel-nosed ray with his bare hands. Finally, Phil faces a creature we all love to hate‚Äîthe mosquito‚Äîand discovers there‚Äôs more to these tiny bloodsuckers than meets the eye.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Within the Channel Country deserts, Indigenous educator Phil Breslin scours the endless sands to find three animals that not only survive the heat but thrive in unrelenting conditions. programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: The Christmas Island red crab is a land bound crab that still has strong ties to the ocean, the only place where they can give birth to their young.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: Ain't love grand? Well, to many animals in the wild, attracting a mate and getting the chance to breed is more like a blood sport. The mating urge drives animals to make long journeys, to let down their guard in the presence of predators, and even to fight each other to the death.

programme.title: Deep Sea Dwellers
programme.desc: Movie special-effect gurus are forever trying to invent more compelling creatures from other planets, hoping to terrorize our imaginations. programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how polar bears hunt prey, offering new perspectives on the tactics they use to track, stalk and ambush seals, whales and walruses. programme.title: Killer Whale Chronicles
programme.desc: Orcas are the rulers of the seas. These majestic marine mammals have captured the hearts of people with their intelligence and complex family structures. programme.desc: A forensic look at how cheetahs hunt their prey, offering new perspectives on the tactics employed by these expert predators when stalking, chasing and bringing down antelope and wildebeest. Following a young cheetah mother over 18-months as she teaches her three cubs the secrets of the hunt.
